The project of AE2DMS Coursework of Yizirui FANG 20127091

Package: com.ae2dms.model.GameGrid This is the class to place the graphic objects of the game to present

  • Constructor Details

    • GameGrid

      public GameGrid​(int columns, int rows)
      This constructor is the default constructor. This constructor will create a array of GameObject with specified number of columns and rows. to initialize the array of GameObject storing the current level.
      Parameters:
      columns - the size of columns of the GameGrid
      rows - the size of rows of the GameGrid

  • Method Details

    • translatePoint

      public static java.awt.Point translatePoint​(java.awt.Point sourceLocation, java.awt.Point delta)
      translate the point sourceLocation by delta in x and y axis
      Parameters:
      sourceLocation - the source location of the game object
      delta - the delta value this source need to translate
      Returns:
      java.awt.Point

    • getGameObjectAt

      public GameObject getGameObjectAt​(int col, int row) throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      check if the input col, cow is within the boundary and return the GameObject at the input position. If no, throw exception and promote in console if in debug mode
      Parameters:
      col - the column index of the searched game object
      row - the row index of the searched game object
      Returns:
      com.ae2dms.model.GameObject
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      Parameters:
      p - the point of the game object
      Returns:

    • putGameObjectAt

      public boolean putGameObjectAt​(GameObject gameObject, int x, int y)
      put the game object at the defined position, return true if success; false, otherwise.
      Parameters:
      gameObject - the game object to be put
      x - the x value in the x axis to put the game object at
      y - the y value in the y axis to put the game object at
      Returns:
      boolean

      Parameters:
      gameObject - the game object to be put
      p - the point the game object should be put at
      Returns:
